course_title: Special Topics: Human Health: Health Writing and Narratives
class_notes: This class teaches students to write about health and science for a general audience, exploring a range of genres while also training them in timeliness, thoroughness, accuracy, and evidentiary rigor. Completed work may be published in the CSHH online journal, Exploring Health. (Prerequisite: HLTH 210 OR HLTH 250; Permission only, by application)
course_description: Seminar of lecture series of topics in human health. May be repeated for credit when topic varies. Credit varies from one to five hours.
sections: Class Nbr: 2965, Section #: 1, Type: LEC, Campus: ATL, Meets: W 6-8:45p, Instructor: McKenna/Raymond, Status: Open
